str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To dwell around, be neighboring to. From peri and oikeo; to reside around, i.e. Be a neighbor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Mountainous, hilly, the hill-country. From oros; mountainous, i.e. the Highlands.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dia and laleo; to talk throughout a company, i.e. Converse or publish.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
